WaitlistEntry.title: WaitlistEntry
WaitlistEntry.description: Represents a user's entry in the Charon Waitlist.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Waitlist Entry.

submissionTimestamp.description: Timestamp of when the user submitted the form.

definition.description: Stores entries from the waitlist form. No auth is required, but data validation is enforced via rules.

params.name: waitlistEntryId
params.description: Unique identifier for the WaitlistEntry document.

definition.description: Collection to store administrator user IDs. Presence in this collection grants admin privileges.

params.name: uid
params.description: The Firebase User ID of the administrator.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore data structure is designed to securely store waitlist entries while adhering to the principles of Authorization Independence, Structural Segregation, and Access Modeling. It leverages denormalization where appropriate to avoid costly `get()` calls in security rules and to ensure atomic operations. Additionally, segregation is employed for admin functions.  The structure supports QAPs by ensuring secure list operations via clear ownership patterns and explicit role definitions.

*   **/waitlist_entries/{waitlistEntryId}**: Stores information collected from the waitlist form.  This collection is publicly writable with server-generated IDs, but requires validation of content. The 'submissionTimestamp' captures the submission time.
*   **/roles_admin/{uid}**: This collection uses "Existence over Content" to grant admin privileges. The existence of a document with the user's `uid` in this collection signifies admin status. This is checked using `exists()` in the security rules for admin-only data access.

This structure promotes clear, maintainable security rules due to its explicit ownership and role definitions, and avoids complex hierarchical dependencies.  It also naturally allows for administrative access by checking membership in the `roles_admin` collection.
